intro: Sphaerostephanos lastreoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stephanos, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are typically narrow and arranged alternately along the stem. Sphaerostephanos lastreoides is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky slopes.
